Our Core Programs

Guns for Toys Program

Our innovative program allows community members to safely surrender unwanted firearms in exchange for gift cards. The surrendered guns are properly disposed of, and the funds raised help purchase new stuffed animals for children in crisis.

Learn More

First Responder Kits

We provide special kits to police officers, firefighters, and EMTs containing stuffed animals they can give to children they encounter during emergency situations. These kits help first responders build trust and provide immediate comfort.

Learn More

Guns for Toys Program

Transforming potential dangers into sources of comfort for children.

Our Guns for Toys program addresses two critical issues simultaneously: reducing the number of unwanted firearms in homes and providing comfort to children experiencing trauma.

Participants can anonymously surrender unwanted firearms at designated drop-off events throughout the year. In exchange, they receive gift cards that can be used at local businesses. All surrendered firearms are properly documented and safely disposed of according to local regulations.

How It Works

  1. Collection: We collect new and gently used stuffed animals through donations, drives, and our Guns for Toys program.
  2. Preparation: All donated stuffed animals undergo thorough cleaning and sanitization according to our strict protocols.
  3. Distribution: We partner with hospitals, police departments, fire stations, and social service agencies to distribute stuffed animals to children in need.
  4. Impact: Children receive a comforting friend during difficult times, helping them cope with stress and trauma.
Program Impact
  • Over 25,000 stuffed animals distributed annually
  • Partnerships with 75+ organizations across the region
  • Serving children in 12 counties
  • Reduced anxiety and improved emotional well-being for recipients
